verses.kjv: Moreover the word of the LORD came unto Jeremiah the second time, while he was yet shut up in the court of the prison, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD's message came to Jeremiah a 2nd time while he was still confined in the courtyard of the guard. It said:

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD the maker thereof, the LORD that formed it, to establish it; the LORD is his name;
verses.ct: "This is what the LORD says — the one who made the earth, the LORD who shaped it and set it in place; the LORD is his name:

verses.kjv: Call unto me, and I will answer thee, and shew thee great and mighty things, which thou knowest not.
verses.ct: Call out to me, and I will respond. I will show you remarkable and hidden things that you don't know about.

verses.kjv: For thus saith the LORD, the God of Israel, concerning the houses of this city, and concerning the houses of the kings of Judah, which are thrown down by the mounts, and by the sword;
verses.ct: For this is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says about the buildings of this city and the palaces of the kings of Judah that have been torn down to defend against the siege ramps and the enemy's attacks:

verses.kjv: They come to fight with the Chaldeans, but it is to fill them with the dead bodies of men, whom I have slain in mine anger and in my fury, and for all whose wickedness I have hid my face from this city.
verses.ct: The people go out to fight the Babylonians, but they will only fill those ruins with their own corpses — people I have killed in my anger and rage. I have withdrawn my favor from this city because of all its wickedness.

verses.kjv: Behold, I will bring it health and cure, and I will cure them, and will reveal unto them the abundance of peace and truth.
verses.ct: Yet look — I will restore health and healing to it. I will heal its people and give them an overflow of lasting peace and security.

verses.kjv: And I will cause the captivity of Judah and the captivity of Israel to return, and will build them, as at the first.
verses.ct: I will bring back the captives of Judah and the captives of Israel, and I will rebuild them as they were before.

verses.kjv: And I will cleanse them from all their iniquity, whereby they have sinned against me; and I will pardon all their iniquities, whereby they have sinned, and whereby they have transgressed against me.
verses.ct: I will wash away all the sin they committed against me. I will forgive every offense — every sin and every act of rebellion against me.

verses.kjv: And it shall be to me a name of joy, a praise and an honour before all the nations of the earth, which shall hear all the good that I do unto them: and they shall fear and tremble for all the goodness and for all the prosperity that I procure unto it.
verses.ct: Then this city will bring me joy, praise, and honor in front of every nation on earth. They will hear about all the good things I do for my people, and they will tremble with awe at all the prosperity and well-being I provide for it."

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD; Again there shall be heard in this place, which ye say shall be desolate without man and without beast, even in the cities of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem, that are desolate, without man, and without inhabitant, and without beast,
verses.ct: This is what the LORD says: "You call this place a wasteland with no people or animals. In the towns of Judah and the streets of Jerusalem — now empty, without a single person, resident, or animal —

verses.kjv: The voice of joy, and the voice of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom, and the voice of the bride, the voice of them that shall say, Praise the LORD of hosts: for the LORD is good; for his mercy endureth for ever: and of them that shall bring the sacrifice of praise into the house of the LORD. For I will cause to return the captivity of the land, as at the first, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: there will once again be sounds of joy and celebration, the voices of grooms and brides, and the voices of people singing, 'Give thanks to the LORD of Hosts, because the LORD is good and his mercy lasts forever!' They will bring offerings of thanksgiving into the LORD's house. For I will restore this land from captivity, just as it was before," says the LORD.

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD of hosts; Again in this place, which is desolate without man and without beast, and in all the cities thereof, shall be an habitation of shepherds causing their flocks to lie down.
verses.ct: This is what the LORD of Hosts says: "In this place that is now a wasteland without people or animals, and in all its surrounding towns, there will once again be pastures where shepherds rest their flocks.

verses.kjv: In the cities of the mountains, in the cities of the vale, and in the cities of the south, and in the land of Benjamin, and in the places about Jerusalem, and in the cities of Judah, shall the flocks pass again under the hands of him that telleth them, saith the LORD.
verses.ct: In the hill country towns, in the lowland towns, in the southern towns, in the territory of Benjamin, in the areas around Jerusalem, and in the towns of Judah — flocks will once again pass under the hand of the one counting them," says the LORD.

verses.kjv: Behold, the days come, saith the LORD, that I will perform that good thing which I have promised unto the house of Israel and to the house of Judah.
verses.ct: "Pay attention — the time is coming," declares the LORD, "when I will fulfill the good promise I made to the people of Israel and the people of Judah.

verses.kjv: In those days, and at that time, will I cause the Branch of righteousness to grow up unto David; and he shall execute judgment and righteousness in the land.
verses.ct: In those days and at that time, I will raise up a righteous Branch from David's line. He will carry out justice and righteousness throughout the land.

verses.kjv: In those days shall Judah be saved, and Jerusalem shall dwell safely: and this is the name wherewith she shall be called, The LORD our righteousness.
verses.ct: In those days, Judah will be rescued and Jerusalem will live in safety. This is the name it will be given: 'The LORD Is Our Righteousness.'"

verses.kjv: For thus saith the LORD; David shall never want a man to sit upon the throne of the house of Israel;
verses.ct: For this is what the LORD says: "David will never lack a descendant to sit on the throne of the nation of Israel.

verses.kjv: Neither shall the priests the Levites want a man before me to offer burnt offerings, and to kindle meat offerings, and to do sacrifice continually.
verses.ct: And the Levitical priests will never lack someone to stand in my presence, offering burnt offerings, presenting grain offerings, and making sacrifices — always."

verses.kjv: And the word of the LORD came unto Jeremiah, saying,
verses.ct: Then the LORD's message came to Jeremiah:

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD; If ye can break my covenant of the day, and my covenant of the night, and that there should not be day and night in their season;
verses.ct: "This is what the LORD says: If you could break my covenant with the day and my covenant with the night, so that daylight and darkness no longer come at their proper times —

verses.kjv: Then may also my covenant be broken with David my servant, that he should not have a son to reign upon his throne; and with the Levites the priests, my ministers.
verses.ct: only then could my covenant with my servant David be broken, so that he would have no descendant reigning on his throne — and my covenant with the Levitical priests who serve me.

verses.kjv: As the host of heaven cannot be numbered, neither the sand of the sea measured: so will I multiply the seed of David my servant, and the Levites that minister unto me.
verses.ct: Just as the stars of the heavens can't be counted and the sand on the seashore can't be measured, that is how I will multiply the descendants of my servant David and the Levites who minister to me."

verses.kjv: Moreover the word of the LORD came to Jeremiah, saying,
verses.ct: The LORD's message also came to Jeremiah:

verses.kjv: Considerest thou not what this people have spoken, saying, The two families which the LORD hath chosen, he hath even cast them off? thus they have despised my people, that they should be no more a nation before them.
verses.ct: "Have you noticed what these people are saying? They claim, 'The LORD chose 2 families but has now rejected them both.' They look down on my people as if they are no longer a nation in their sight.

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD; If my covenant be not with day and night, and if I have not appointed the ordinances of heaven and earth;
verses.ct: This is what the LORD says: If I have not established my covenant with day and night, and if I have not set the fixed laws that govern the heavens and the earth —

verses.kjv: Then will I cast away the seed of Jacob, and David my servant, so that I will not take any of his seed to be rulers over the seed of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob: for I will cause their captivity to return, and have mercy on them.
verses.ct: only then would I reject the descendants of Jacob and my servant David, refusing to choose any of his offspring to rule over the descendants of Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob. But I will restore them from captivity and show them mercy."
